content:
Gödel’s Incompleteness → True but Unprovable Statements

Gödel showed that any sufficiently powerful logical system (like arithmetic):

is either incomplete (cannot prove all true statements)

or inconsistent (proves contradictions)

He built a self-referential sentence:

“This statement is not provable.”

If the system proves it, the system is inconsistent.
If it cannot prove it, the statement is true — showing the system is incomplete.

This self-referential trick is the heart of incompleteness.

Creating game engine could be a long time goal that will need expertise in scripting language (to avoid compiling again and again, or hot code reloading can be a good move), memory management, particle simulation packaging and delivery.

I really liked Cave but as of now I think I can start the journey with Struckd
The idea is to go like: Struckd -> Unity -> Maybe Godot for sometime -> My Own

I think development of game is the ultimate goal. Via this road, I can cherish my ultimate dream of storytelling.

Today's AI is jack of all trades master of none. If we need a specialist AI, we need to train it to be that. And this trained AI will be all proprietory, private. So, AI trainer and fine tuners will be in demand.
I have taken MBT test and it suggests I am a logician(?) INTP-T... Will take another test a few months from now... Lets see if it changes
Today's world has all the things that can help human to go the next stage of evolution.
